alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties through 715 PM MDT/815 PM CDT/... At 641 PM MDT/741 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles southwest of Leoti, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
